name: Hotel Meridiana

reviews.text: An average one overall. Nice and clean but rooms are on the small side. Bathrooms have apparently just been renovated but not other areas. Breakfast OK, great cappuccino but you will have to wait in a queue to order over the counter.
reviews.title: Acceptable but would look for somewhere esle next time

reviews.text: The night we arrived the coffee machine at the mini-bar next to the reception broke down. No drinkable hot water and the man on night shift asked us to use those from the basin!
reviews.title: Nice place!

reviews.text: Price and surrounding reasonable. Do not recommend walking. Bus nos. 1 & 7 take you to the centre in less than 10 minutes. Taxi should cost no more than 10 euros without luggage.
reviews.title: Reasonable budget hotel

reviews.text: Overall a nice place...clean, comfortable and the staff was helpful. It is walking distance to the sites, but the bus is also convenient. The breakfast was nothing great and the dining area not the most appealing.
reviews.title: Definitely a good choice for Florence

reviews.text: Stayed here for a week at the end of April 2005. Rooms are tiny compared to American standards BUT definitely average for European budget hotel. Our room and bathroom were neat and clean. This hotel is not centrally located but is a pleasant walk (15min-30min depending to where) from pretty much anything that you'd want to see. There are also many buses 1, 7, 12, 13 that run often and whose schedules are posted that take you to all the sights under 5-10min. I think the front desk sells bus tickets and there is a tobacco shop a block away that does too. Breakfast is buffet style - croissants, rolls, cereal, juice adn coffee/tea. If you get tired of it, there are a multitude of pastry stores nearby. There is also a grocery store a block away. My only complaint was that 2 of the nights, there was a tour of young girls on our floor who ran around yelling til the wee hours of the morning. We did complain and they were less loud but walls are thin- you can hear doors opening and closing and people in the hallway. After they left, it was quiet so was more a problem with the guests than hotel. This is definitely a more than adequate hotel for those on a budget.
reviews.title: Good Hotel
Nice Modest Hotel
reviews.text: We just returned from Italy which included a stay at this Hotel. The rooms are modest but we had a beautiful hillside view from our huge window and the room was always spotless. They have a nice breakfast room downstairs with all your basic European breakfast needs, including fresh made cappucinos. This was all included in price of room. Location is a bit out of the way but bus stop on corner takes you right to Duomo. Also there are 2 wonderful restaurants on same street, we asked at the desk and they made reservations for us. Nice place to stay.

reviews.title: A little out of the way for old legs
reviews.text: Our stay, March 4-7, 2005, Florence being a walking town, we did our share. This hotel was a pretty good distance from the sights, although we did do a lot of walking to and fro and a bit of cab rides. As far as the hotel, it was clean, big rooms, big baths, the breakfast was very good. The staff was helpful. The airline lost all our luggage,but we all got it by the second day, it is amazing what you can survive without. Around the corner is a grocery for water,etc., a bank atm on the next corner, plenty of restaurants around the hotel. We took cabs from the airport and cost 12 euros. We had two doubles and a triple. Traffic noise muffled by the windows, so maybe double paned. This hotel was part of our package so I am not sure of the price, but most likely budget. If you cab it everywhere or can walk easily, stay here,otherwise, find a hotel closer in to Florence.

Stayed here as part of a package. It's about a 15-20 minute walk to the city center, you go past the Academy where the Statue of David is. The rooms are small but comfortable and the bath is nice. Breakfast is ok but the coffee was wonderful. If you're on a budget or part of a package this is definitely an OK place to stay and would do so again.
reviews.title: It's clean, safe and quiet and I'd stay there again.
Good quiet location within walking Distance of Attractions
reviews.text: Clean and comfortable beds. Top floor room was very small but had balcony with view of mountains and city. Staff was helpful. Stayed one week with my wife. Found a great bakery/delicatesen just down the street. Used that and and a nearby supermarket for most of our eating. There was a nice restaurant several bloocks east. Would not recommend Alfredo's down the street. Expensive fillbelly. Continental breakfast was satisfactory but limited. We were glad to be away from the noise and crush of tourists downtown at night. Walked everywhere north of the river. Would probably use again, since hotels are primarily for sleeping. Loved Florence and the art scene!!!

reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.text: Hotel was about 20-25 minute walk to the centre of Florence. The room was clean, with a good shower and the staff were friendly. The only downside were the banging of doors late at night and in the early hours from other guests 'coming and going'. It did get on your nerves after a while and stopped a good nights sleep. Probably wouldn't stay here again for that reason.
Staye here for three nights in July 05. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Hotel and room (on top floor) clean and of good size. It's main problem was it was too far out of the centre of Florence.
reviews.title: Too far from the Centre
